p: A 49-years old female diagnosed with HIV infection 8 years ago under regular ART (anti-retroviral therapy) went to our clinic for fatigue (day 1 of illness). He got a fever (day 4) with a maximum temperature of 38 ℃, accompanied by pharyngeal pain. The patient showed chills on day 5. Considering the clinical symptoms, the sputum sample was collected for RT-PCR assay of SARS-CoV-2 and the chest computed tomography (CT) was performed.
